class moduslam.data_manager.batch_factory.readers.data_reader_ABC.DataReaderState[source]

Bases: ABC

Stores positions of iterators for sequential data reading.

class moduslam.data_manager.batch_factory.readers.data_reader_ABC.DataReader(regime: Stream | TimeLimit, dataset_params: DatasetConfig)[source]

Bases: ABC

Base abstract class for any data reader.

__init__(regime: Stream | TimeLimit, dataset_params: DatasetConfig) → None[source]
Parameters:

  • regime – data flow regime.

  • dataset_params – parameters of the dataset.

abstract __enter__()[source]

Opens the dataset for reading.

abstract __exit__(exc_type: type[BaseException] | None, exc_val: BaseException | None, exc_tb: TracebackType | None)[source]

Closes the dataset after reading.

abstract set_initial_state(sensor: Sensor, timestamp: int) → None[source]

Sets the iterator(s) position(s) for the given sensor and timestamp.

Parameters:

  • sensor – sensor to set the iterator(s) position(s) to.

  • timestamp – timestamp to set the iterator(s) position(s) to.

Raises:

  • RuntimeError – if the method is called outside the context manager.

  • ItemNotFoundError – if no measurement for the given sensor and timestamp is found.

get_next_element() → Element | None[source]
get_next_element(sensor: Sensor) → Element | None

@overload.

Gets element from a dataset sequentially based on iterator position.

Returns:

element with raw measurement or None if all measurements from a dataset have already been read.

Raises:

RuntimeError – if the method is called outside the context manager.

get_next_element(self, sensor: moduslam.setup_manager.sensors_factory.sensors.Sensor) → moduslam.data_manager.batch_factory.batch.Element | None[source]

@overload.

Gets element from a dataset sequentially based on iterator position for the specific sensor.

Parameters:

sensor – a sensor to get measurement of.

Returns:

element with raw measurement or None if all measurements from a dataset has already been processed.

Raises:

RuntimeError – if the method is called outside the context manager.

abstract get_element(element: Element) → Element[source]

Gets the element with raw measurement from a dataset for the given element without raw measurement.

Parameters:

element – existing element without raw measurement.

Returns:

element with raw measurement.

Raises:

RuntimeError – if the method is called outside the context manager.

Factory for creating DataReader instance based on a dataset type.

Creates Data Reader based on dataset type.

Parameters:

  • dataset_config – configuration of the dataset.

  • regime_config – configuration of the data flow regime.

Raises:

NotImplementedError – No DataReader exists for the given dataset type.

moduslam.data_manager.batch_factory.readers.utils module

moduslam.data_manager.batch_factory.readers.utils.set_state(sensor_name: str, timestamp: int, data_sequence: Sequence[tuple[int, str, int]], sensor_source_table: dict[str, Source]) → None[source]

Sets the iterator position for the given sensor and timestamp.

Parameters:

  • sensor_name – name of sensor to set the iterator position.

  • timestamp – timestamp to set the iterator position.

  • data_sequence – sequence of data.

  • sensor_source_table – table of sensors and their sources.

Raises:

ItemNotFoundError – if no measurement found for the sensor at the given timestamp.

Read a csv file and yield each row.

Parameters:

  • file_path – path to the csv file.

  • delimiter – line objects delimiter.

Yields:

a row of the csv file.

Filters “sensor <-> source” table by the given sensors.

  • sensors – a set of sensor names to be used.
